title: All the Birds in the Sky
author: Anders, Charlie Jane
note: Nebula winner for best novel

title: Sleeping Giants
author: Neuvel, Sylvain
note: the mystery of the bizarre artifact remains unsolved

title: Seed to Harvest Bundle
author: Butler, Octavia E.
note: everyone recommends Octavia Butler

title: The Wrong Stars
author: Pratt, Tim
note: It starts with a deep-space salvage crew discovering a seemingly long-abandoned ship that turns out to have one occupant—who, once revived, warns them of an alien race that mixes advanced technology with pure evil.

title: Fragile Things
author: Gaiman, Neil
note: Contains Sherlock Holmes/Cthulu story

title: Europe in Autumn
author: Hutchinson, Dave
note: By the author of Acadie

title: Killing Gravity
author: White, Corey J.
note: a nicely diverse cast, a cute space ferret of death and a female protagonist most often referred to as a void-damned space witch. I feel like you don't need to know much else.

title: Provenance
author: Leckie, Ann
note: From the author of Ancillary Mercy

title: Gods, Monsters, and the Lucky Peach
author: Robson, Kelly

title: Mechanical Failure
author: Zieja, Joe
note: 'Remarkable & Sarcastic: When Rogers returns after only a year away, something has changed. These are soldiers—actual soldiers doing actual soldier things like preparing for a war that Rogers is sure doesn’t exist. Rogers vows to put a stop to all this nonsense—even if it means doing actual work.'

title: The Boy on the Bridge
author: Carey, M.R.
note: by the author of The Girl with All the Gifts
series: The Girl With All the Gifts #2

title: Shadow & Claw
author: Wolfe, Gene
note: Gene Wolfe’s enigmatic Shadow of the Torturer is always a treat.
series: The Book of the New Sun #1-2

title: Lilith's Brood Bundle
author: Butler, Octavia E.
note: Recommended to Kara and by many people on Twitter in the wake of the white boy writing about slavery debacle

title: The Emperor's Blades
author: Stavely, Brian
note: In 2014, Brian Staveley burst onto the scene with The Emperor’​s Blades, an excellent start to a fantasy epic. io9: modern epic fantasy mixed in with a nice dose of Lovecraftian weirdness https://goo.gl​/3NbQD3

title: Singularity Sky
author: Stross, Charles
note: A space opera universe I invented circa 1996 and set two novels in—originally to be a series, but, alas, due to internal consistency issues I won't be writing any more of these.

title: Iron Sunrise
author: Stross, Charles
note: A space opera universe I invented circa 1996 and set two novels in—originally to be a series, but, alas, due to internal consistency issues I won't be writing any more of these.

title: The Rift
author: Allan, Nina
note: A woman goes missing as a teen and returns 20 years later, claiming she’s spent the intervening time on another planet. Her sister is thrilled but is unsure about whether or not she should believe those tales of intergalactic travel.

title: Pandemic
author: Riddle, A.G.
note: Author of Atlantis Gene

title: Fluency
author: Wells, Jennifer Foehner
note: found while browsing: 'NASA discovered the alien ship lurking in the asteroid belt in the 1960s. They kept the Target under intense surveillance for decades, letting the public believe they were exploring the solar system, while they worked feverishly to refine the technology needed to reach it.'

title: Three Parts Dead
author: Gladstone, Max
note: Craft Sequence is an amazing series of urban fantasy novels, set in a richly imagined world where magic is treated more like law or coding than something mystical.​

title: Coyote
author: Steele, Allen M.
note: US becomes an oppressive regime, group of dissidents steal a starship to colonize a moon. …looks as the challenges of settling a colony on an alien world with alien biology, as well as the politics involved in recreating a society away from Earth.

title: The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay
author: Chabon, Michael

title: Waste of Space
author: Damico, Gina
note: Imagine The Real World—in space. …the kids are actually on an elaborate soundstage. The deception makes for a ratings hit, but things get weird when the cast is tricked into believing they’ve suddenly lost all communications with Earth.

title: The Gone-Away World
author: Harkaway, Nick
source: Recommended to Kara, and by Professor Elemental

title: Armada
author: Cline, Ernest
note: by the author of Ready Player One

title: Gnomon
author: Harkaway, Nick
note: 'You want to know how good GNOMON is? I hate him for it. Haaaate. I had a little hategasm just typing those words.' — Warren Ellis, also by http://aworkinglibrary.com/reading/gnomon/

title: Retrograde
author: Cawdron, Peter
note: The international team at the Mars Endeavour colony is prepared for every eventuality except one—what happens when disaster strikes Earth?

title: The Rise and Fall of D.O.D.O.
author: Stephenson, Neal and Galland, Nicole

title: A Wizard of Earthsea
author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
note: Recommended by someone… 'favorite by proxy'?

title: Constitution
author: Webb, Nick
note: Recommended by author: Galactica-like

title: The Bloodline Feud
author: Stross, Charles
note: parallel-universe techno-thriller by Charles Stross

title: Behind the Throne
author: Wagners, K.B.
note: Orbit Books is responsible for some of the most exciting space adventures out there:, including James S.A. Corey’s Expanse series, Kim Stanley Robinson’s Aurora, and Ann Leckie’s Ancillary trilogy.

title: Left Hand of Darkness
author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
note: 'A lone human ambassador is sent to Winter, an alien world without sexual prejudice, where the inhabitants can change their gender whenever they choose.'

title: Artemis
author: Weir, Andy
note: From the author of the Martian
